column4: Hi Guys/Gals, I have Ubuntu 7.10 ... i'm having problems connecting to my home internal network, can you please advise what to use .... thnx in advance
How exactly do you want to connect to your home internal network?  Do you want to share files?  Do you want to login to remote machines? What?
accessing shared files from Linux is much easier than sharing them from Linux.  To share them from Linux, you have to set up a server called samba.

It was last time I did it.  abcent: May be worth looking around to see if there are any easier, newer instructions.  Someone was in here talking about a smb4k app he was using to configure samba awhile ago.  But, he couldn't get t to work either.
